page.title: 20All Saints Church. Cont...
page.content: Manor(W.B.Hesketh) to erect a handsome Hotel in the place of the old village inn,"The Horse and Jockey".This is of course "The Hesketh Arms". In 1869 Warehousemen and Clerks School (now Cheadle Hulme School) moved to Cheadle Hulme and the Anglican scholars began to worship each Sunday at All Saints.A pupil who was there from 1883 to 1888 remembers how they used to march to church twice every Sunday in all weathers and on dark nights the big boys would carry lanterns to light them along the way. A church extension was eventually needed to accommodate the increased congregation and in 1877 William Bradshaw Watson gave land for this. Cheadle Hulme has grown tremendously since 1945 as a residential area for Stockport and Manchester.The present vicar is the Rev.Neil Brunning.
